original_text: Hydrides, once precipitated in zirconium, degrade the mechanical properties of a component, leading to reductions in tensile strength, ductility and fracture toughness [35–40]. These changes can ultimately compromise the integrity of cladding during normal operating life , accident conditions and fuel storage [13]. As well as the degradation of mechanical properties, the presence of hydrides can also affect phenomena like pellet cladding mechanical interaction (PCMI); or introduce mechanisms for failure, such as delayed hydride cracking (DHC). The former mechanism is the product of thermal expansion in fuel pellets introducing stresses into the cladding, which may then lead to the formation of cracks in areas made brittle by large hydride concentrations [13]. The latter mechanism, DHC, is a sub-critical, time dependent cracking phenomenon that requires long range hydrogen diffusion for repeated local hydride growth and fracture at a hydrostatic tensile stress raiser [5,41,42]. The process occurs over an extended period of time under a continuously applied load that is below the yield stress of the material [5,41,42].
original_translation: Los hidruros, una vez precipitados en el circonio, degradan las propiedades mecánicas de un componente, lo que conduce a reducciones en la resistencia a la tracción, la ductilidad y la tenacidad a la fractura [35-40]. Estos cambios pueden comprometer en última instancia la integridad del revestimiento durante la vida operativa normal, condiciones de accidente y almacenamiento de combustible [13]. Además de la degradación de las propiedades mecánicas, la presencia de hidruros también puede afectar fenómenos como la interacción mecánica entre el pellet y la envoltura (PCMI); o introducir mecanismos de falla, como la fisuración por hidruros retardada (DHC). El mecanismo anterior es el producto de la expansión térmica en los pellets de combustible, introduciendo tensiones en el revestimiento, lo que puede llevar a la formación de grietas en áreas que se vuelven frágiles debido a altas concentraciones de hidruros [13]. El mecanismo mencionado anteriormente, DHC, es un fenómeno de agrietamiento subcrítico dependiente del tiempo que requiere difusión de hidrógeno a larga distancia para el crecimiento repetido de hidruros locales y la fractura en un punto de tensión hidrostática [5,41,42]. El proceso ocurre durante un período prolongado de tiempo bajo una carga aplicada continuamente que está por debajo del límite elástico del material [5,41,42].
original_sentences: Hydrides, once precipitated in zirconium, degrade the mechanical properties of a component, leading to reductions in tensile strength, ductility and fracture toughness [35–40].
These changes can ultimately compromise the integrity of cladding during normal operating life , accident conditions and fuel storage [13].

As well as the degradation of mechanical properties, the presence of hydrides can also affect phenomena like pellet cladding mechanical interaction (PCMI); or introduce mechanisms for failure, such as delayed hydride cracking (DHC).

The former mechanism is the product of thermal expansion in fuel pellets introducing stresses into the cladding, which may then lead to the formation of cracks in areas made brittle by large hydride concentrations [13].

The latter mechanism, DHC, is a sub-critical, time dependent cracking phenomenon that requires long range hydrogen diffusion for repeated local hydride growth and fracture at a hydrostatic tensile stress raiser [5,41,42].
The process occurs over an extended period of time under a continuously applied load that is below the yield stress of the material [5,41,42].

El mecanismo mencionado anteriormente, DHC, es un fenómeno de agrietamiento subcrítico dependiente del tiempo que requiere difusión de hidrógeno a larga distancia para el crecimiento repetido de hidruros locales y la fractura en un punto de tensión hidrostática [5,41,42]. El proceso ocurre durante un período prolongado de tiempo bajo una carga aplicada continuamente que está por debajo del límite elástico del material [5,41,42].

original_annotated_sentences:
Hydrides
, once precipitated in zirconium, degrade the mechanical properties of a component, leading to reductions in tensile strength, ductility and fracture toughness [35–40].
These changes can ultimately compromise the integrity of cladding during normal operating life , accident conditions and fuel storage [13].

As well as the degradation of mechanical properties, the presence of
Hydrides
can also affect phenomena like pellet cladding mechanical interaction (PCMI); or introduce mechanisms for failure, such as delayed hydride cracking (DHC).

The former mechanism is the product of thermal expansion in fuel pellets introducing stresses into the cladding, which may then lead to the formation of cracks in areas made brittle by large hydride concentrations [13].

The latter mechanism, DHC, is a sub-critical, time dependent cracking phenomenon that requires long range hydrogen diffusion for repeated local hydride growth and fracture at a hydrostatic tensile stress raiser [5,41,42].
The process occurs over an extended period of time under a continuously applied load that is below the yield stress of the material [5,41,42].

Estos cambios pueden comprometer en última instancia la integridad del revestimiento durante la vida operativa normal, condiciones de accidente y almacenamiento de combustible [13].
